metadata.Title: CVE-2016-4476 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
hostapd 0.6.7 through 2.5 and wpa_supplicant 0.6.7 through 2.5 do notreject \n and \r characters in passphrase parameters, which allows remoteattackers to cause a denial of service (daemon outage) via a crafted WPSoperation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-4476` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

hostapd - 1:2.4-0ubuntu6.2
wpagui - 2.4-0ubuntu6.2
wpasupplicant - 2.4-0ubuntu6.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wpa package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4-0ubuntu6.2').
wpa package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4-0ubuntu6.2').
